intro: Vincetoxicum dasystephanum, commonly known as the purple false-berry, is a perennial shrub native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many toxic plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, fragrant, white to purple flowers. Its fruits are follicles that contain seeds, and the plant is often found in moist, wooded areas. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is considered a potentially harmful plant to handle or ingest.
